Argon is blue-white. I think it's mostly chlorine, with a bit of metallic oxygen

- - - Updated - - -

Let's focus on the story. Realism is no fun.

> 
> Argon is blue-white. I think it's mostly chlorine, with a bit of metallic oxygen

[No, it's the Argon that contributes to density, and a few white marks. Oxygen is known not to exist in the atmosphere, but, although Chlorine is unknown, it is not likely]

The blackhole ships start tractoring blackholes into eachother. Using some extraordinary science and stuff they manage to make a blackhole the size of 100x bigger than a normal galactic core. The blackhole ships have gravity-resistant hull plating, but even with it they are still having trouble not getting pulled in. They have to have their engines in FTL mode just to go to a full stop near the black hole.
Soo... yeah

I... Sense a disturbance... It continues!!

- - - Updated - - -

Nuax, cease at once! Resist your urges, or there will be consequences.

- - - Updated - - -

We approach gridmark 27, the core of this species operations. Estimated time to encounter: 11 minutes

The soldiers are noticing that the commanders are getting sick and so they start to analyze the controls so I can make that remote.

Oh yeah, and that killing thing? Just a hoax. Me and my forces want no one outside of the spacecraft other than me and my infinite army from knowing.

But the galaxy smashing in? It means that Kerbol is going to collide with a star, and Jool is going to melt, and that just makes our job easier and harder all at the same time.

> 
> The soldiers are noticing that the commanders are getting sick and so they start to analyze the controls so I can make that remote.
> Oh yeah, and that killing thing? Just a hoax. Me and my forces want no one outside of the spacecraft other than me and my infinite army from knowing.
> 
> But the galaxy smashing in? It means that Kerbol is going to collide with a star, and Jool is going to melt, and that just makes our job easier and harder all at the same time.

[Do you realize how much force is required to alter movement of a whole galaxy? You have to move every string within it with an equal amount of force, and if you know how many object are in Andromeda, you will know that there doesn't exist that much energy to move it so quickly in the entire universe]

I finally get control of the spaceship when I receive the hot news and toss the remote to a soldier. I then hop along a Crew docker with just myself to the spacecraft. I am wearing a everything-proof suit, so I can't get infected. I dock up with warp tech, and then I put all the forces on the spacecraft in there. I get in the other spacecraft, they undock, and I inform the crew of a planet called B1-47 in my galaxy, which is like Jupiter and Jool as well.

EDIT: (Sorry, I'm just using the fact that this is a story. I built high tech stuff by exploiting radioactive dark matter or something and it falls into the hands of an anonymous stupid soldier.)

The Venusian empire forms on Venus. It establishes an economy, which they invest completely in spamming millions of warships incredibly rapidly.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-15T18:12:51Z" title="07/15/2015 06:12  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 15, 2015</time> by Souper**

I say that everyone on-board the spacecraft has to sign a treaty for peace (for just that one instant) if we want to make it to B1-47 and maybe even get to my home planet, mK-CAP$ in the same solar system, so we can catch up on any news.

A have a feeling the story has again degenerated into n factions claiming n land.

Sampa sneaks up behind me and knocks me out.

- - - Updated - - -

Is anyone there?

The Venusian empire, with its 15 billion-strong (HUGE) army of 5 km long warships, was declared war on Sampa. They annex 25% of their territory before their warships deplete, where they then garrison themselves in their new territory and spam trillions upon trillions of 15 km long advanced warships. If they are not stopped, they will take over the entire Lanikea!
[in case you missed it, Sampa's currently fighting the Krynn, and if you were smart, you would to. Not like you would stand a chance anyway, but still]

I declare war on the Venusian Empire, and begin launching 500 megaton Kinemetic warheads at Venus. The surface is transformed into molten stone at 50,000 Celsius and the Venusian economy collapses.

- - - Updated - - -

I'm in a state of half-infection because of the partial cure Sampa gave me. I'm lying unconcious in a reactor control room.

Ok, let me start this whole thing over.

The Venusian Empire is formed on Venus, and uses it's economy to build an army of 1 million warships, seizing control over the Sol system and initiating the extermination of all humans inside it.
